attributes.action: Repeal the National Guidelines regarding dental extraction under general anaesthetic by an NHS dentist
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
These Guidelines removed a previous service offered by NHS dentists, namely dental extraction under general anaesthetic.

Patients who require this method of extraction are now faced with either a painful wait for an extraction at a dental hospital (12 to 18 months), or an emergency referral to a private practice, costing hundreds of pounds.

Stop this 'back-door' privatisation of the NHS.
